detail: We have a lovely large room to rent with a view of our garden. It should be free from the second or third week in January. There is an original fireplace, a double bed with room underneath for storage, plenty of shelving, a small wardrobe and a clothes rail  and a little desk by the window that overlooks our garden. This is for just one person, not a couple, owing to pressure on the bathroom and kitchen.The room is in a terraced house just off Church Street. I own the house and live here with my 19-year-old daughter and our dog. Sorry, we can‚Äôt take any other pets ‚Äì he is quite enough for us to manage! As we are an all-female household we feel more comfy with another female. We‚Äôve shared our house with many lodgers over the years. We find that those who fit best often have busy lives of their own, as we do but we enjoy a chat in the kitchen as we come and go. I‚Äôm an ad creative and my daughter is currently on a gap year.There‚Äôs a kitchen with a dishwasher, a downstairs loo and an upstairs bathroom with a bath with a shower. There‚Äôs also a utility room. No tumble dryer.It‚Äôs a great location, just off Church Street but near the High Street. We are very close to Abney Park and Clissold Park is just a wander away past all the shops and cafes of Church Street. A little further is the famous Castle Climbing Centre and open water swimming reservoir. The leisure centre is nearby for indoor swimming, gym etc. There‚Äôs the Farmers Market at the weekend in the High Street. Transport links include buses on Church Street (73 heading for Angel and central London, the 393 to Highbury) buses on the High Street,(149 up to Seven Sisters tube or down to Dalston), Stoke Newington station is near.The rent is ¬£750, paid by direct debit. . The deposit is one month‚Äôs rent, paid in advance. The bills are ¬£140 a month which include utility bills, broadband, council tax, ( band E) TV licence, water. However, if the monthly usage on the utility bills increases then there will be additional charges. We don‚Äôt usually put the heating on during the working weekday. We all clean the house.A reference from an employer is required. We have had many people sharing our house with us over the years and especially love those from other countries. We find that people who have busy independent lives tend to fit best in the house. Sorry, there isn‚Äôt storage space outside your room other than a few pots and pans in the kitchen. There are bike storage units in the street which you can rent from the council.Drop me a message if you think you might like living here and fit in well, we really enjoy meeting people from other countries and people with interesting hobbies.

detail: Hello!We are looking for a new flatmate to rent a room in our lovely home!The house:Room Rent - ¬£775 per monthBills come to roughly ¬£115 - ¬£125 a monthFlexible move in date, but need to fill before January 1st.The room is a spacious double in a Victorian terraced house. Separate laundry room with washing machine and dryer. There are actually 5 bedrooms in total, giving us a spare bedroom for if family/friend want to visit (we don‚Äôt rent this out in respect to the landlords who keep the rent decent for us in exchange of keeping this room free). Nice tall ceilings across the house. Alex‚Äôs favourite point to show off is our lovely garden, which is fairly huge and grows beautiful roses, grape vine and wildflowers in the spring.We are located within 15 minute walk of both Seven Sisters (Victoria line) and Turnpike Lane (Piccadilly line) tube stations. We are pretty chill generally as people. We keep a clean house overall and divvy up the cleaning that needs to be done. We are friendly and sociable whilst being respective of peoples space. Love a good pub trip or film/game night when we can but also happy to just chat over making dinner or slump on the sofa to watch some tv together after a long work day.‚Ä®‚Ä®Alex (27- she/her) is originally American but has lived in the UK for 20 years. She works in Arts education and enjoys art, going to the pub, board games, and bagels. Jackson (30 - he/him) is from New Zealand. My lovely flatmate is unfortunately moving out as the commute is too long for her new job, so I‚Äôm looking for someone to take over the lease in our beautiful, spacious Hither Green Home. My room is on a separate floor with its own en-suite so the flat feels very spacious and we both have a lot of privacy.We absolutely love the area! EXTRA LARGE DOUBLE ROOM IN HARRINGAY N4 - with double bed available in a young, friendly, non-smoking house-share. High coved ceilings, bright and very spacious. This period property is located in a quiet, tree-lined road. A fully fitted kitchen - upstairs and downstairs extra-large luxury showers - a comfortable lounge overlooking a south facing garden - GCH and WiFi.The house is close to Underground stations, National Rail stations, buses, shops, banks, caf√©s, gyms, libraries, bars, restaurants and pubs.TRANSPORTHarringay N4 has excellent transport links, such as the Piccadilly and Victoria lines, which will take you into Central London within 20 mins.Harringay Train Station, (Great Northern Rail), is only 8 minutes walk away and goes to Finsbury Park, Highbury & Islington, Kings Cross, Old Street - terminating at Moorgate Station in just 15 minutes.(Another nearby London Overground station, Harringay Green Lanes, is on the Barking to Gospel Oak Suffragette line).There are great bus connections to the City and West End. The 24-hour buses 341, 141 and 29 go to Waterloo, London Bridge and Trafalgar Square via Camden Town..THE AREAHarringay N4 is a trendy, vibrant area in North London and has a multitude of independent shops and culinary delights on Green Lanes high street - many of which are open 24hrs, 7 days a week.  You‚Äôll love the Dusty Knuckle Bakery, the cool Brouhaha cocktail bar and the recently opened Sushi Co. which offers late night deliveries. You won't find a more delicious Sunday roast than that served by Stamp Brasserie - with free top-ups of potatoes and veg !Fancy a pint? Check out The Old Ale Emporium and The Salisbury tavern - which also includes a Chinese restaurant, Little Dragons.Time for some shopping therapy - the Arena Retail Park is a 10 minute walk - Aldi, Sainsbury's, Argos, TK Maxx, Sports Direct, Next, Costa Coffee, McDonald's etc.Wood Green Shopping Mall is one of the largest in London and only 10 mins away by bus - shops galore!  The Mall also includes a Cineworld Cinema and a large Market Hall which has a fantastic selection of small independent traders, selling everything from fashion and beauty products to electricals and quick bites to eat. Whatever you‚Äôre looking for you‚Äôll find in the Market Hall. Oh, and just up the road near Wood Green Station is a 6-screen, state-of-the-art Hollywood Vue Cinema complex.Harringay also has numerous nature trails - and includes the Railway Fields Nature Reserve, (only 8 mins walk from the house) - described as a tranquil escape from the hustle and bustle - a haven for wildlife with over 200 plant species, 60 bird species and 21 types of butterflies.A 15 min walk will take you to the famous Finsbury Park which has a boating lake, skate park, outdoor gym, caf√©; basketball, netball, and volleyball courts ‚Äì  a venue for festivals, concerts, fun fairs, circus‚Äôs and displays.Also close by are the open spaces of Woodland Park, Wetland Reservoirs, Cissold Park, Chestnuts Park, Downhills Park, Stationers Park, Priory Park and Lordship Recreation Ground.For the active amongst you, there are gyms and fitness centres nearby - and the Castle Climbing Centre is only 10 mins away by bus.A must visit is Alexandra Palace, (Ally Pally as it‚Äôs affectionately known). From this impressive Grade II listed building you get a beautiful, panoramic view of London. It includes an ice-rink (with skating lessons if you wish), the Palm Court Atrium and The Phoenix pub. This iconic venue has hosted film premieres, Red Bull racing, boxing, snooker, ice hockey and darts. Previous live gigs include The Rolling Stones, Pink Floyd, Led Zeppelin and the London Symphony Orchestra. Other events at Ally Pally include theatre, arts & crafts & food festivals, exhibitions, podcasts, panel discussions, workshops and tours. Something for everybody ! Alexandra Park Station is a mere 5 minute journey from Harringay Station.Please make contact to arrange a viewing ASAP!!      :  )

detail: A beautiful, light and bright room that is cosy but surprisingly spacious! I‚Äôve lived here for 3 years but am moving in with my partner so unfortunately it‚Äôs time to go.As seen in the pictures, there are two windows - the large one is east-facing, the smaller, frosted one is south-facing - so you get a lot of light all year round.The room comes furnished with the following:Double bed and mattressStorage trunk (at end of bed)WardrobesChests of drawers (except pine one with mirror)Full length, free-standing mirrorNB: I may sell other furniture in the room so please do ask if you‚Äôre interested. Additionally, our landlord is fairly relaxed about removing furniture so this can be negotiated.THE HOUSEIt‚Äôs a three-storey, semi-detached townhouse in a private, gated mews. There are 5 other houses assembled around a courtyard. There is a (unoccupied) carport for our house if you need somewhere to park, visitor parking is available for guests, and there are several bike racks.The ground floor opens on to a hallway with a small bathroom (toilet), the kitchen, and a storage area under the stairs.On the first floor is the advertised room, one other bedroom (Amelia‚Äôs), and a bathroom. The bathroom is shared only by you and Amelia, and features a bath and shower, as well as built-in storage and another small cupboard under the sink.On the second floor lives a couple, Monique and Felix, with their room and bathroom on a self-contained floor.KITCHENA fully integrated kitchen with gas hob, oven, dishwasher, washing machine, fridge and freezer. We also have an air fryer, microwave, toaster, kettle etc. You will have your own separate pantry cupboard and there are additional mutual storage cupboards. We share all crockery/cutlery/pots/pans, and split the cost of oil, salt/pepper, cleaning supplies etc.Though we don‚Äôt have a separate living room, there is a couch in the kitchen where we often hang out.GARDENWe are very lucky to have a massive garden, shared with the neighbours, with three separate washing lines, a BBQ, veggie patches for each house, and several picnic tables and chairs. Amelia also has an inflatable pool that we made good use of in the summer! Our neighbours maintain the garden but anyone can access the lawnmower etc too.THE AREABecause we‚Äôre on a side street off another side street, it‚Äôs surprisingly quiet for a bustling area, with Peckham road just a minute away.We are perfectly situated between Camberwell and Peckham‚Äôs high streets, with South London Gallery at the end of the street and Toad Bakery and The Peckham Pelican only two blocks away. We have a Sainsbury‚Äôs Local across from Toad and of course a wider selection of supermarkets in Camberwell and Peckham.There are excellent bus connections to central and south London, as well as to local tubes - Oval (Northern line), Elephant and Castle (Northern/Bakerloo), and Vauxhall (Victoria) are the closest by bus. Peckham Rye train station is a 15 minute walk from the house, where you can access overground and national rail services.FLATMATESYou will be living with three lovely flatmates - Amelia, Monique, and Felix. While we do our own thing and have busy lives, I‚Äôve always felt welcome to join in - both together with them and also with my flatmates‚Äô friends dinners, cinema trips etc. Amelia and I even went travelling together earlier this year! It‚Äôs been a really lovely, honest, down to earth household, and I‚Äôll be sad to leave!Amelia is Canadian and has lived in the U. K. for a few years. She is a SEND teacher locally, working Monday - Friday. She loves to make art, play badminton, and cosy up with‚Ä¶.‚Ä¶.her 1.5 year old tuxedo cat named George! He is a rascal but pretty adorable (especially when tired!). He is very much part of the household so please don‚Äôt apply if you don‚Äôt like/are allergic to cats!Monique and Felix are both from Cornwall but have lived in London for a few years. Monique is a SEND teaching assistant and Felix is a gardener at Kew. They both work Monday-Friday. When they‚Äôre not cooking up something *delicious*, they‚Äôre often out at gigs or the cinema.RENTThe rent is ¬£725/month and bills are shared between us (approximately ¬£110 a month).YOUWe are looking for a long-term tenant who is friendly, respectful, and responsible. As we are all professionals, we sadly can‚Äôt accept students. The moving date is flexible - please get in touch with any questions.Maddy (outgoing tenant)

detail: Hey everyone,I am subletting my 14 sqm room for one month, from 18 December to 18 January.The room is spacious, bright, and receives plenty of natural light. Everything you might need ‚Äî supermarkets, bars, restaurants ‚Äî is just around the corner.The sublet is in a townhouse shared with six other people. The house has four floors, and my room is the only one on the ground floor. The flatmates are students and young professionals, mostly in their late twenties. It is an international and friendly household. We get along well; people occasionally spend time together, but everyone is usually busy studying or working, so the house stays calm. Because we all have different schedules, it never feels crowded.There are two full bathrooms (one located on the ground floor) plus an additional toilet. The shared spaces include a large kitchen, a small common room, and a small patio.We are looking for a friendly, calm, and sociable person ‚Äî ideally a student or young professional in their twenties or early thirties ‚Äî who needs a short-term place for exactly one month. The room is also suitable for someone spending the holiday period in London. I will be away during the holidays, and several flatmates will also be gone for shorter periods, so at times only two to four people will be in the house.If you are interested, feel free to contact me, even if you need the room for a shorter stay. I (professional mum - solicitor) work from home but very often I travel to Greece (almost every 1.5 month).Mary, 18, is last year in A Levels so she is reading in her room most of the times if she is not in college.  During half terms Christmas Easter and summer ( from June until Sept) we are mostly away.This is the biggest  room of the property, y will have also your working desk in the room if y work from home. Exclusive bathroom use can be considered for a budget of 1300 per month. Kitchen is separate to living room and quite spacious to accommodate lunch, dinner etc available to common use. It also leads to a handy patio which we are turning  it into a green place (we just moved in ).  Location is super if y like activities and y are an active person.  Exactly opposite we have Sobell Leisure Centre 2' walk door to door offering a massive gym,  yoga, pilates, spinning, tai chi, squash, badminton, weights, boxing , y name it, while 5' cycling we have a same chain leisure centre wt swimming pool! In the flat we have a bathroom wt shower, a separate WC and extra shower room. Kitchen is quite spacious with kitchen table leading to a patio which we are fixing right now and expected to be soon very beautiful to sit outside during summer months.  Located in vibrant Islington close to Finsbury park with amazing transport links with the picadilly line (stations: Holloway Road, Arsenal and Finsbury Park) and Victoria line at Finsbury Park alongside national rail from Finsbury Park station. There are also multiple buses around the area and Holloway Road. And the property is just  20 mins away from King's Cross.If y are a female and a cat lover, we are looking forward hearing from you.

There is also an air filter which keeps the apartment fresh and a number of plants!There is a big table/workspace where you can plug your laptop in with a very comfy chair. A great place in case you work from home, with lots of storage.The kitchen comes fully equipped and will have all the essentials you will need to cook up a storm. Wine cooler, dishwasher and washing machine/dryer. Pots and pans etc.The lighting in the apartment is all philips hue smart lights. You can use the switches as normal but you can also switch up the ambience in the evening and ask Alexa for dimmed lighting.The bathroom comes with an amazing waterfall shower (not exaggerating!). There is also a charging port for shavers.The bedroom has a Super King Bed with extremely comfortable mattress. Bookshelf with some reads I am trying to get through as well as a small selection of DVDs. A full wardrobe for hanging your clothes and storing shoes, as well as a big chest of drawers. There is also an ironing board and iron. For those of you looking to bring your fluffy friends, there are bowls under the sink for their water and food as well as a number of toys. There is also an air conditioning unit, which is perhaps not so useful now unless you use the dehumidify mode.The bedroom now has Venetian blinds (not shown in images), which is great for privacy with this top floor apartment. It is also on the side of the apartment with the road so you have to be okay with people driving by in the night and maybe slight noise from any locals walking by. It is central London after all! Lastly, this is a second floor apartment without a lift so please be aware for accessibility.

The deposit is ¬£680.‚Ä¢All bills are paid by the landlord, except for the gas and electricity bill which the housemates share and which now, on average, is about ¬£40/month per person.‚Ä¢The landlord pays for the Council Tax, the water bill, the infinite Wi-Fi, and the regular cleaner who keeps the general areas well-maintained.‚Ä¢You are expected to keep your room clean and tidy as well as clean after yourself in the general areas.The property comprises:‚Ä¢a spacious lounge/diner,‚Ä¢a fully fitted kitchen,‚Ä¢a fully fitted bathroom,‚Ä¢an added facility of a separate WC room with a basin,‚Ä¢a sunny garden with dining facility.‚Ä¢The unlimited optical fibre broadband allows easy working from home when needed.‚Ä¢We have an eco-friendly gas-heating system which is thermostatically controlled for the whole house as well as within each room.‚Ä¢The property has a high C, EPC rating (close to B) which means bills are generally low.‚Ä¢The house is within walking distance of all the amenities in a bicycle-friendly area ‚Äì thus, there is a safe space for bicycles through a side gate.‚Ä¢There are two regular bus services: the W11 runs every 10minutes from a bus stop a few metres from the house; the158 runs every 7 minutes from a bus stop within a short walking distance from the house.‚Ä¢The N73, N123 and N158 night bus service runs along Forest Road and Billet Road respectively.‚Ä¢Blackhorse Road and Walthamstow Central, on the Victoria Line, are 10-15 minutes walking distance. Oxford Circus is only 30 minutes by tube from Walthamstow Central and 20minutes from Blackhorse Road.‚Ä¢A rail service runs every 15 minutes from Walthamstow Central to Liverpool Street (on the Central Line) and takes just20 minutes. The Silver Link rail service from Gospel Oak to Barking passes through Blackhorse Road and Walthamstow Station.‚Ä¢The North Circular, M11 and A12 are a few minutes‚Äô drive or bicycle ride from the property.

Offering a bright, furnished double room in a spacious, welcoming apartment in Peckham - best suited to a mid-career professional who enjoys a calm, clean home with a bit of culture and creativity in the mix.**The room**Wooden floors, a big sash window with morning sunshine, and comes furnished with a solid wood bed + John Lewis mattress, desk, bookshelf, and clothes rail. Happy to chat about tweaking, removing, or upgrading furniture.**The flat**First-floor flat looking out onto green spaces, with two separate living spaces (great if you WFH 1 - 2 days a week), plus kitchen, separate bathroom and toilet, and one other bedroom.Main living room: plants, records, books, and big comfy sofas.Second space: set up for working, with upright piano and guitar you‚Äôre welcome to use.**Location + transport**Plenty of buses via Old Kent Road into central London. 15min walk to Queens Road Peckham and South Bermondsey. 20min to Peckham Rye Station. Bike storage on the apartment balcony is easy.Local area great for access to Burgess Park, good local cafe's and varied restaurant selections in Peckham or Old Kent Road (I love Banook Bagels), and very close to art galleries and workshops if you're into pottery (LIMBO & Space Studios).**House vibe**Open, inclusive, and friendly. The flat stays pretty calm - you‚Äôll sometimes hear the TV on, or records spinning in the living room, but it is rarely noisy past 9pm. Kitchen and bathrooms are kept very clean and tidy; living spaces are relaxed but respectful.Henry (your housemate) is a mid-career professional and works from home 1 - 2 days per week. He works in cinema sales and is into films, music, and theatre, with the occasional bit of acting too. Busses also serve the area for all directions across London.The Thames Path is directly opposite the apartment with cycling and running path following the Thames towards Battersea Park and beyond to Central London to the East and Putney/Barnes/Richmond to the West.Open plan kitchen. 52 inch TV, broadband, Netflix, Amazon Prime, Paramount+ all included. Storage in the hallway, dishwasher, washing machine, microwave, oven, grill, large fridge/freezer.  ALL BILLS INCLUDED.My preference is to live with a female as, from experience, I prefer the balance of having one guy, one girl in the apartment.*PARKING* as mentioned above, there is off street, secure parking underneath the development which can either be paid for by the hour (short term) or long/medium term. I  like  to  foster  an  environment  that‚Äôs  calm  and  relaxing  for  people  with  busy  &/or  differing  schedules,  though  we  r  of  course  welcoming  &  friendly!WetroomThe   self-contained   wetroom   adjoins   the   bedroom   &   has   large   white  tiles  &  a  newly  installed tray with glass doors framed in black &  accented  by   an   aqua   blue   Lustrolite   full-length   feature   splashback   with   a   white   sink   &   mirror.   A   large   filtered  overhead   shower   (counteracts  the  hard  water!)  &   heated   white   towel   rail   with   heated   flooring   complete   the   space.Sunny  KitchenSituated  on  the  1st  floor,  a  bright sunny  Kitchen/Living   spaceWith a  full   range   of   utensils,   washer/dryer,  dishwasher,  ironing   facilities,   fridge,   microwave,   oven,   glass   table   &   chairs,   toaster   &   kettle.TechnologyFast  &   reliable   fibre   optic   WiFi.Hard   wired   Ethernet   connection   for   laptops.Room   sockets   with   USB   charger   ports.IMPORTANTNOTE   1:   I   have   a   long-haired   friendly,   well-behaved   black   cat   named   Poppi  though   she   tends   to   stay   on   the   ground   floor   :)NOTE   2:   Strictly   no   smokersNOTE   3:   Working   professionals   only   pleaseThe   neighbourhoodThere   are   a   huge   number   of   great   restaurants,   takeaways   or   places   to   just  relax.  Clapham  Common  &  Brockwell  Park  in  walking  distance.LOCATIONLocation-wise,   you   are   right   on   the   Clapham/Brixton   border   with   a   10-12   minute   walk   to   Clapham   North  (plus  Clapham  Common  &  Clapham  South)  tube   on   the   Northern   Line   and   similar   walking   distances   to   the   Victoria   (Brixton   15   mins)   and   the   Overground   lines   (Clapham   High   Street   13   mins).Clapham   and   Brixton   are   vibrant   areas   offering   a   thriving   scene   for   clubbing   and   live   music   as   well   as   a   vast   array   of   pubs,   cinemas,   gyms,   swimming   pools,   supermarkets,   and   shops.   Both   are   well-known   for   nightlife  along   with   many   other   interesting   local   bars,   pubs,   clubs   and   Pop   Brixton   &   Brixton   Village   restaurants   to   explore.Clapham   is   renowned   for   its   village-like   atmosphere,   and   the   restaurants   on   Abbeville   Road   are   a   short   12-minute   walk   away.   Clapham   Common   is   great   for   walking,   cycling   and   hosts   first   class   music   concerts,   theatre,   and   film   shows.You   are   only   a   5-minute   walk   from   the   local   bars   and   restaurants   üëçLocal   Shops   (5   to   15   mins   walk)  -  Sainsbury‚Äôs  &  Waitrose  in  Clapham  &  Tesco  &  Lidl   on   Acre   Lane.GETTING   AROUNDTransportThere   are   excellent   and   reliable   transport   links,   with   Oxford   Circus   just   15   mins   by   tube.   With   night   trains   at   the   weekend   (Charing   Cross   branch   of   Northern   Line),   and   frequent   night-buses   every   night,   the   whole   of   London   is   very   accessible.Walking   distance   to   the   numerous   train   links:   -Clapham   North   tube   (Northern   line)   ‚Äì   12   minsClapham   High   Street   (Overground   line)   ‚Äì   13   minsClapham   Common   tube   (Northern   line)   ‚Äì   15   minsBrixton   tube   (Victoria   line)   ‚Äì   15   minsCyclingThere   are   Cyclehoop   storage   facilities   for   your   bike   just   opposite   the   house   &   rental   bikes   on   Clapham   Common.ParkingParking   is   free   after   7pm   in   the   evening,   and   on   Saturdays   and   Sundays.There   is   a   parking   meter   in   an  adjacent  street  for  parking  outside  these  hours.  border

detail: Large 4-bedroom semi-detached house located in the private cul de sac of Pointers Close, E14. The property has a modern, very large kitchen/dining room, with all appliances including washing machine, fridge-freezer, oven, hob and extractor fan and multiple base and wall kitchen units. The property also has a good size rear garden and a private driveway. (More parking spaces available around the property).Bedrooms:4x double bedrooms (inc. one bedroom with a private balcony)Bathrooms:2x Luxury en suites1x shared bathroom1x ground floor restroomOther features:Private balconyVaillant Gas BoilerThe property comes fully furnished.The house has river site view and is 15 meters away from the riverfront alleyLocation and transport:Mudchute and Island Gardens DLR stations are both less than 10 min walk away.There is a bus stop 3 min away with the following buses stopping: 277, D7 and N550.Canary Wharf station is within 20 min walk or a 10 min cycle.4 min. walk to the Masthouse Terrace Pier-Thames Clipper stationAmenities and shops:Multiple trendy restaurants, bars, takeaways, convenience stores and a large Asda supermarket within a 10-15 min walk.There are numerous gyms, rowing clubs, an astro turf as well as Millwall park.Greenwich Foot Tunnel is within 6min. walking distance from the house. On the south side of the tunnel, you will find Greenwich market, Greenwich park (inc. the Observatory), Greenwich University, Cutty Sark and numerous restaurants, bars, pubs and cafes.The property is situated in a fantastic area, with plentiful amenities and transport links next to the riverside (great for morning jogs!).Ideal for sharers.The room is available to move into from 24/12/2025. Please do get in touch with any questions or to arrange a viewing.

detail: We are looking for a new flatmate to share our 4 double bedroom, 2 bathroom home.There's an excellent amounts of common areas so the property has a spacious airy feel and tons of natural light. There's a massive lounge and a separate very good size eat-in kitchen/dining room. The property is located in Harbord St, a quiet residential street just a one minute walk away from the bus stop with both Hammersmith Zone 2 (District, Piccadilly, Circle & Hammersmith and City line) or Putney Bridge Stations walkable or just a few bus stops away.Some of us occasionally WFH but this is maybe one day maximum two per week we are looking for someone in similar position with regular working regular hours. This is a long term let so at least one year contract. The available bedroom has a double bed, desk, dresser and built in wardrobe. Each bedroom shares a bathroom with only one person and both bathrooms have full baths and showers.Local amenities include the new Fulham Pier restaurants, bar, coffee shop and work areas, Bishops park and the River Walk right at the end of the street, great for running, walking or cycling and riverside restaurants/Pubs. There are nice bars, restaurants and handy local shops 5-7 minutes walk away in Munster Village. Putney High St and Parsons Green have major banks, shops, restaurants, nightlife and a cinema also walkable or a quick bus ride. It's a great safe area.We are 3 professionals Ali, Joe and Judrina interested in a clean and respectful friendly house. We like to share a glass of wine watch a trash TV show, but also enjoy our own down time and space. We are 1 male 2 females housemates but you will share a bathroom with a female, most important is a good fit to our vibe and that you are in a similar position in life.If you think you would be a good fit, please message a bit about yourself, included your age, work situation (WFH, hybrid, 9-5, shifts, etc) interests also read and confirm you are able to meet the landlord requirementsLandlord requires1. Proof you are a legal resident of the UK2. Work and Ex landlord references3. One month security deposit4. UK based GuarantorBills are not included and Gas, electric, water, wifi, council tax are estimated to be ¬£100 per month per personWe will be doing viewings for those who meet the requirements in person only. Viewing will be Dec 3rd so you will need to be available to meet with us thenMove in date Jan 4th or beforeParkingOutside there is on-street parking for two cars, with allocated permits available for purchase directly from the council. There is a place to secure a bike outside but it's not under cover BIKES ARE NEVER ALLOWED INSIDE THE FLAT.

** Young professional houseshare *** Available from 1 December 2025 ** Weekly cleaner *We have a ensuite single room in a five bedroom house share in East Acton (East Acton is in zone 2 on there as Central Line.). The room is c 10 sqm in size: it is on the first floor (bedroom 3 on the floorplan).The room is available from 1 December 2025, and all bills are included in the rent. We also have an excellent cleaner, who comes every week. The cost of the cleaner is included in the rent.* Location *The house is less than 10 mins walk to East Acton tube station, and a 5 minute drive to Hammersmith hospital. With the expansion of the Westfield shopping complex, the amenities in the area are ever improving. With the window open for circulation, food smells don‚Äôt linger.Great size sink, built-in washing machineMini fridge with tiny freezer (there is under counter space for second freezer unit if needed).Microwave not provided but can be considered if needed. A lot of people bring their own appliances, and then I've got nowhere to store unwanted items from the lodger room.Electric kettle and basic crockery provided, one small pot and streamer pot provided. There's 183cm clearance underneath to stand up straight!Not everyone loves a high sleeper; a regular bed can be added or setup re-arranged if preferred.No bedding included (can borrow pillows, duvets, covers and sheets if needed short-term for a small fee).Room always warmly heated in winter ‚Äî it‚Äôs the warmest room in the property.LOCATION7-min walk to East Finchley tube Northern line.1 min walk to High Street.Small garden accessible occasionally via shared lounge/bedroom/playroom by prior agreement (e. g., for drying large laundry).SHORT STAYS- RE-ADVERTISING FEE EXPLAINEDBecause I don‚Äôt lock people into strict year-long contracts, it offers you the flexibility of a shorter stay ‚Äî six months is preferred, but as little as two/three months can be agreed ‚Äî without the commitment of a full year.The re-advertising fee (already part of listed deposit) is essentially the cost of that flexibility- finding new lodgers more often is both costly and time-consuming. I‚Äôm flexible on when you leave, except notice period cannot run during December and August please, July may be ok, more below.The ¬£125 re-advertising fee applies to stays of 12 months or less and is fully refunded if you stay 13 months or more.---NOTICE PERIODOne full CALENDAR month‚Äôs notice is required i. e. You give notice latest at end of one month then the notice period runs from the 1st to the 31st of the following month.I ask notice period is not to run during the following months due to busy school holidays and potential travel plans thus my unavailability to arrange viewings to replace you: December, July & August.Your understanding and planning to avoid these months is greatly appreciated, and this will be part of the lodger agreement.NOTESA short-term lodger may potentially stay in our adjacent bedroom on occasion ‚Äî this has never happened before and likely won‚Äôt; mentioned for transparency ‚Äî it would have no impact on your privacy in the self contained lodger room.3 BASIC HOUSE RULES1- Please remove outside shoes either just outside the front door or as you enter to help keep the hall clean.2-Close the front door gently ‚Äî a soft click is enough; no need to slam or push hard.3- There's no curfew ‚Äî come and go as you please. Just kindly keep noise to a minimum at all times.Partial Council Tax Band D included.Any questions welcome, feel free to message me.

Available asap  Short let or long letNo couples please but will consider for short let.Summary2 double rooms available the smaller short let and bigger  room longer let inclusive of all bills, is available in a friendly, chilled, creative house with all mod cons including a great coffee machine the room is open to all walks of life especially creative types.The big room has a wooden double bed, a fold away table and a large built-in the wall wardrobe with plenty of selves, hanging space and cube storage too.The smaller room has a wooden bed small double, a wardrobe and cube draws. Both rooms have under bed storage and we can add more shelves if needed. The price includes all bills and free parking. We also have cats, so you must be an animal lover!HouseThere is a communal living room with a real wood-burning fireplace. Patio doors lead to a generous garden with a brick barbecue, a pond with koi and goldfish, a tree-hung hanging chair, and additional seating at the back. It‚Äôs a real suntrap that backs onto a park. There is also a covered patio with a dining table, making it a great spot to sit all year round.The kitchen features an industrial-style fridge and freezer, so there's plenty of space for your food. It also includes a super-silent, fast washing machine. The kitchen is a great space to cook in and includes a hatch through to the living room.The bathroom is shared and features both a double shower and a double bath.Free parking is available outside the house, and there is a side covered entrance for securely locking up bikes.The house has fast wireless broadband, Sky, and access to all major streaming services for those cosy nights, films and series.AreaThere are lots of local shops nearby, including a butcher and a 24-hour convenience store and massive pub, plus a lovely park directly behind the house. There‚Äôs also an Aldi and a Sainsbury‚Äôs Local nearby, and a Morrisons and large shopping centre in Wood Green.Bruce Grove station has just a roller disco, and there are two affordable multiplex cinemas in Wood Green. I also use the outdoor heated swimming pool in Crouch End, which isn‚Äôt far.In terms of transport, Turnpike Lane and Wood Green (Piccadilly Line) are close by. Slightly further are Seven Sisters and Tottenham Hale (Victoria Line) it takes me 20 mins to Kings Cross door to door but the nearest station is Bruce Grove Overground about a ten min walk which is just one stop from Seven Sisters and only 20 minutes to Liverpool Street on the overground. Buses at the top of the road go directly to all four stations, so you don‚Äôt have to walk if you‚Äôre not in the mood.YouSomeone with a professional job, but we will also consider students too. Ideally, you‚Äôll work or study on-site, as one of us already works from home‚Äîbut we‚Äôre also happy to consider a hybrid setup if it‚Äôs only a couple of days a week. The  big room does includes a fold-away table.Smoking and vaping are fine‚Äîbut only in the garden, not in the house.UsYou‚Äôll be sharing with a photographer originally from Cornwall and a teacher originally from Sunderland. We‚Äôre easygoing, got a great sense of humour, active, and love gardening, art, music, travel, woodworking ‚Äîand, of course, photography. This isn‚Äôt a party house, but we enjoy the occasional drink and chat after work, while still respecting each other‚Äôs space. There‚Äôs plenty of room in the house and garden for alone time. Mainly looking for a good fit.And yes‚Äîyou must love cats, because there is a few.Bobby
